member.name: T:SkinSoft.OSSkin.SkinMode
member.summary: Specifies how the application is skinned.

member.name: F:SkinSoft.OSSkin.SkinMode.Manual
member.summary: The application is skinned manually by calling the and methods for each form or control.

member.name: F:SkinSoft.OSSkin.SkinMode.Automatic
member.summary: All application forms and controls are automatically skinned.

member.summary: Specifies what forms and controls are skinned.

member.summary: Skin nothing

member.summary: Skin only forms

member.name: F:SkinSoft.OSSkin.TargetControls.TaggedControls

member.name: T:SkinSoft.OSSkin.ShadowStyle
member.summary: Specifies a shadow style applied to forms

member.name: F:SkinSoft.OSSkin.ShadowStyle.Small
member.summary: Specifies a small shadow

member.name: F:SkinSoft.OSSkin.ShadowStyle.Medium
member.summary: Specifies a medium shadow

member.name: F:SkinSoft.OSSkin.ShadowStyle.Bold
member.summary: Specifies a bold shadow

summary.para: OSSkin is powerful drop-in component that automatically skins any windows forms application from a choice of 18 embedded OS themes and styles. OSSkin uses an advanced skin engine that can skin all windows forms controls, scrollbars and common dialogs without requiring any changes to your projects or source code.
In order to skin your application you only need to drop this component onto the main form or the first visible form of your application at design-time.
Using the properties available on the OSSkin component you can determine which OS style to use, what forms and controls should be skinned and whether to apply translucent shadows to your forms.

Use the property to determine which OS style should be used to skin your application. Use the property to determine what forms or controls you wish to have the skin applied. Use the property to control the appearance of all controls in your application. The and affects the visibility and appearance of the form shadow.

member.summary: Determines if the component license should be serialized

member.name: M:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.Shutdown
member.summary: Manually shuts down the skin engine and disposes all resources.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.ApplySkin
member.summary: Manually applies the skin to the entire application, the application skin is restored using the current settings.
member.remarks:
You would typically call this method after a previous call to to restore the application skin.
This method can be called anywhere in your application.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.ApplySkin(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.summary: Manually applies the skin to the specified form.
member.remarks:
You would typically use this method to manually apply the skin to forms, or when the is set to .
This method can be called anywhere in your application.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.ApplySkin(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Manually applies the skin to the specified control and optional child controls.
member.remarks:
You would typically use this method to manually apply the skin to controls, or when the is set to .
This method can be called anywhere in your application.
member.param: If true, then all child controls are affected; if false then just the control is affected.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.RemoveSkin
member.summary: Manually removes the skin from the entire application
member.remarks: You can call this method anywhere in your application to remove the skin from all forms and controls. You can restore the skin at anytime by calling the method.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.RemoveSkin(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.summary: Manually removes the skin from the specified form.
member.remarks:
You would typically use this method to manually remove the skin from a form, or when the is set to .
This method can be called anywhere in your application.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.RemoveSkin(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Manually removes the skin from the specified control and optional child controls.
member.remarks:
You would typically use this method to manually remove the skin from a control, or when the is set to .
This method can be called anywhere in your application.
member.param: If true, then all child controls are affected; if false then just the control is affected.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.ValidateLicense(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Validates the license using the specified design mode

member.name: M:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Maintains render performance whilst setting the properties, and prevents any unnecessary skin painting until the method is called.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.EndUpdate
member.summary: Resumes skin rendering after painting is suspended by the method.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.Refresh
member.summary: Refreshes the application skin using the current settings.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.License
member.summary: Gets or sets the component license, this method is not intended to be used by client code.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.Site
member.summary: Overridden, see

member.name: P:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.Style
member.summary: Specifies the OS skin style to apply to all target controls

member.name: P:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.SkinMode
member.summary:
Specifies how application forms and controls will be skinned.
Use to manually skin forms and controls.
Use to automatically skin all application forms and controls.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.TargetControls
member.summary:
Specifies which application controls will have the skin applied.
Use to skin no application forms or controls,
Use to skin only application forms,
Use to skin only application controls,
Use to skin all application forms and controls,
Use to skin all tagged application forms and controls,

member.name: P:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.IncludeTag
member.summary:
Specifies a global include tag,
any or whose value matches this string will automatically get skinned, regardless of the setting.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.ExcludeTag
member.summary:
Specifies a global tag,
any or whose value matches this string will automatically have the skin removed, regardless of the setting.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.SkinCommonDialogs
member.summary: Specifies whether to skin the common dialog components, such as the , , etc.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.CustomBackgroundPaint
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable custom background painting, this only applies to the client region of the , and controls.
member.remarks: Normally OSSkin overrides all background painting, when this option is enabled you can override a controls and methods in order to owner draw your own custom graphics.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.SkinSystemControls
member.summary: Specifies whether to skin all native system controls and dialogs.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.ToolStripStyle
member.summary:
Specifies what render style to use. Use to render toolstrips with skinned elements.
Use to render toolstrips with professional skinned colors.
Use to render toolstrips with a combination of system and professional styles.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.ShadowStyle
member.summary: Specifies the shadow style to apply to all forms.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.ShadowVisible
member.summary: Specifies whether the form shadow is visible. The form shadow is a translucent drop shadow effect applied to all application forms.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.HookSystemDrawing
member.summary: Specifies whether to skin parts that are directly drawn by the OS platform.
member.remarks: This is an advanced feature that enables OSSKin to skin custom controls and drawing.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.HookSystemColors
member.summary: Specifies whether to override system colors and replace them with the skin palette.
member.remarks: This is an advanced that enables OSSkin to override the and replace them with the skinned palette.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.OSSkin.OSSkin.UseSystemFonts
member.summary: Specifies whether to use system fonts in place of the skin fonts.
